p: Each of these different food matrices can influence the stability of the flaxseed. Processing of the seed, storage temperature and duration as well as the form of flaxseed (milled flaxseed versus whole seed versus flax oil) will also influence the stability of the product. Milling, grinding or crushing flaxseed will destroy the hard protective seed coat on flaxseed, exposing the ALA and SDG to oxidation [ 12]. However, this process is required to render these bioactive ingredients bioavailable [ 13]. ALA is more bioavailable to the body if it is in oil or milled form [ 13]. The incorporation of milled flaxseed into baked products may actually protect the ALA and SDG from degradation [ 12]. Cooler storage temperatures and a shortened storage duration, particularly for flax oil, will also result in a better preservation of the ALA and SDG [ 12].
